Apparently Maxmaps posted something that leaked it, don't remember that though. I suppose it will be officially confirmed later on.

I'm going to go with "slight whacky physics" being a strong contender.

Jokes aside, I do hope something akin to sub assembly management is introduced. It makes modular building easier, and ties into the whole recycling vibe. But by far the biggest update for me will be when/ if flight and the physics/ rules associated with it get an overhaul; currently aircraft work, but there's some really hilarious physics rules still (infini-glide, sudden expulsion of parts from Kerbol solar system, etc) that make flight a bit derpy.

Out of all the choices on this poll, I'd say that Better Aerodynamics (along with deadly Reentry) is most likely. As all the other choices seem either far off or are simply never going to be added (Female Kerbals).
I think that they may add a crew manifest-like program in it, as that needs to be done soon.

As much as I *want* a new aerodynamic model, I suspect it won't be changed until well-after career mode gets flushed out a bit more. Since that's their current push, I suspect money and missions are probably close on the horizon.

Also, some part rebalancing is long-overdue. Actually, of all the things they could do next patch, this would take very little time (only a few hours, maybe a day or two) and would be very welcome. I'm tired of using the bulkier Mk2 Fuselage because it is lighter and carries more fuel than the Mk1.

Which isn't squad confirming it, even in the video Scott uses words like "probably," "hinted," etc. Is it likely? Yes. But not confirmed by squad in that video, and the info Scott is referring to doesn't sound like a confirmation either.

Not that I'm saying that it won't be there, but there has been at least one other occasion where something regarded as confirmed by the devs didn't make it into the patch. When asked about it, the devs said "Where did you get the idea that we were going to do that?" at which point the community just looked around confused, as noone had any clue where the idea had come from originally, and noone had tracked down the supposed confirmation, they just assumed that whoever had started the idea had verified the confirmation.

I think that they may add a crew manifest-like program in it, as that needs to be done soon.

Why do we need that when we have already got it in game? You can add Kerbals to more than one capsule now by clicking on the Kerbal next to the action groups icon. As long as you've hired enough Kerbals, with that you can put your ship up to maximum capacity.

So no Resources right now ... And in my personal opinion they are almost pushing this to a DLC in the future and may not be in the main game
